column3: Great job on this non-trivial CS1 lab!
utc_day returns negative values: Due to subtracting 3 after %7, you're going to get negative days, which will be a problem. utc_day_test4() should catch it in runtests.py
local_day should call utc_day - why write a function if you don't use it? We avoid repetitive code!
utc_day/local_day: neither of these should return a float, it should be an int
day_of_week should [possibly] return all days of the week
this file needs to be written
Don't use pre-calculated constants for arithmetic without explaining where they came from
simplify the Thurs -> Sun adjustment in utc_day (used if/else instead of +4 before %7)
local_day should not cast to an int, that should happen in utc_day
Don't forget to add a test to the runtests.py file!
Nice job with the else block in catching unexpected input in day_of_week!
Comments are needed for more complex chunks of code.
Too much comments also makes code difficult to navigate/read! Try to just get at the bare minimum of functionality/explanation.
Do not remove the docstrings (comments between the ''' ...''') at the top of functions: they're VERY useful!
Unnecessary print() statements should be removed before submitting the assignment
